body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioner states that at the March Term 1864 of the Laurel Circuit Court, a Judgment was rendered against him for twenty dollars for Retaling Liquors. He states that he is a very poor man and has a family who are dependant upon his labor for a support that he has been verry unfortunate since the commencement of the rebellion having been robbed by the rebels of all his property not even sparing his and his family clothing nearly all of which was taken that he is unable to pay the fine without subjecting himself and family to hardship, and great inconveinence
He therefore prays your Excillency to remit said fine
James Braughton says the statements in the foregoing Petition are true
Sworn to before me by James Braughton 12th May 1864

The undersigned citizens of Laurel County are well acquainted with James Braughton we believe the statement in the foregoing petition are true and would Respectfully ask your Excellency to remit said fine

C B Davis
Granville Pearl
Wm T. Moren
Thos. J. Canifax
S C Jackson

Laurel Circuit Court
VS
James Braughton
Refused
